page.title: 07GOODNESTONE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Goodnestone Village Hall formerly the forge, is leased to four Trustees, they oversee its use under control of a committee. Lord FitzWalter leases the hall for a rent of Â£1 a year. He is a committee president. The chairman is a stationer, The Vice_Chairperson a housewife. The Treasurer a district nurse. The Secretary a college lectu_ rer. Committee members include a farm worker, a gardener, a retired nurse, a retired teacher, an office worker, a builder and a housewife, a sales rep_ resentative and a miner. The hall is not used much. Because of its remote location and size. Organisations using it are: the Womens Institute, the You_ th Club, The Parish Council and the school, which uses it as required.Hir_ ing does not cover overheads, so with the Church we run an annual Fete.
